derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English falden, fealden, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vouwen and German falten
Old English fald, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vaalt

entry.def: If you fold something such as a piece of paper or cloth, you bend it so that one part covers another part, often pressing the edge so that it stays in place.
A fold in a piece of paper or cloth is a bend that you make in it when you put one part of it over another part and press the edge.

example.ex: Make another fold and turn the ends together.

entry.def: The folds in a piece of cloth are the curved shapes which are formed when it is not hanging or lying flat.

example.ex: The priest fumbled in the folds of his gown.
example.tran: 牧师胡乱整了整长袍上的褶皱。

entry.def: If a piece of furniture or equipment folds or if you can fold it, you can make it smaller by bending or closing parts of it.

example.ex: The back of the bench folds forward to make a table...
example.tran: 长凳的靠背可以向前翻折成一张桌子。

example.ex: This portable seat folds flat for easy storage...
example.tran: 这张便携椅可以折叠，便于收纳。

entry.def: If you fold your arms or hands, you bring them together and cross or link them, for example over your chest.

example.ex: Meer folded his arms over his chest and turned his head away...
example.tran: 米尔双臂交叉在胸前，把头转到一边。

example.ex: Mrs Ringrose sat down and folded her hands in her lap.
example.tran: 林罗斯夫人坐下来，双手叠放在腿上。

entry.def: If a business or organization folds, it is unsuccessful and has to close.

example.ex: But as other shops fold, the march of the superstores continues...
example.tran: 但在其他商店纷纷关门倒闭之时，大型超市的强劲扩张势头却依旧不减。

example.ex: 2,500 small businesses were folding each week.

entry.def: When someone joins an organization or group, you can say that they have come into the fold. When they leave the organization or group, you can say that they leave the fold .

example.ex: The EU wanted to bring the US back into the fold...
example.tran: 欧盟想要让美国重新回到他们的阵营之中。

example.ex: He might find it difficult to return to the family fold when he realizes his mistake.
example.tran: 他可能会发现等他意识到自己的错误时再想重返家族已经非常难了。

entry.def: In cooking, if you fold in an ingredient or fold it into the other ingredients, you mix it very gently into the other ingredients.

example.ex: Fold the cream into the egg yolk mixture.

entry.def: If you fold something up, you make it into a smaller, neater shape by folding it, usually several times.

example.ex: She folded it up, and tucked it into her purse...
example.tran: 她将其折叠起来，塞进了钱包里。

example.ex: He folded up his paper and put it away.
example.tran: 他把文件折了几折，然后收了起来。

means.word_mean: 1. an angular or rounded shape made by folding;

3. a folded part (as a fold of skin or muscle)

sentences.sentence: "he gave the napkins a double fold"

means.word_mean: 1. bend or lay so that one part covers the other;
3. incorporate a food ingredient into a mixture by repeatedly turning it over without stirring or beating;

sentences.sentence: "Fold the egg whites into the batter"

means.word_mean: 4. cease to operate or cause to cease operating;

sentences.sentence: "The owners decided to move and to close the factory"
"My business closes every night at 8 P.M."

means.word_mean: 5. confine in a fold, like sheep

年那家报纸于1993年停刊了。

example.en: The show folded after two nights.
example.zh: 那出戏上演了两个晚上就停演了。

example.en: I was ready to go back home as soon as the job folded.
example.zh: 我已准备好工作一结束就回家。

example.en: She said she was about to fold.
